PropertySetConfig.label: The Reason why the Applicant needs the Extension

options.name: ApprovedProvider
options.value: Organisational death or incapacity of proprietor, restructuring, change of key staff involved in decision making, organisational mergers, sale or purchase of age care facilities affecting the provisional allocation

options.name: Contractors
options.value: Difficulties in attracting or keeping contractors or tenders including architects, builders, traders people and industrial problems

options.name: Land
options.value: Land originally estimated to be suitable but later discovered to be unavailable, eg: bushfire regulations, too close to environmentally/culturally sensitive or hazardous sites. Or, no suitable land to be found at acceptable price

options.name: Planning
options.value: Applications for building/development approvals to local government authorises and appeals to other agencies as results of decisions; lengthy process in regard to resident objections etc

options.name: Priorities
options.value: Concurrent refurbishments: additional places being allocated in subsequent rounds requiring re-design, combining provisional allocation construction with refurbishment, That is, other projects happening at the same time.

options.name: SiteProblems
options.value: Physical site problems and weather conditions delaying construction process. Included sites found to be contaminated, on flood plains, subjects to heritage restrictions etc

options.name: Other
options.value: Other reasons, mostly minor delays. Could also include problems in securing agreements to work.
